Posted By: darkcider (3/20/2010 4:28:31 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Yea, the old color hate cards completely lacked any subtlety or strategy. They were all basically "X color deck loses the game". White was the worst offender with cards like [Justice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Justice), [Karma](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Karma), and the circles of protection. My friends and I never used them, and they are the reason that the concept of sideboarding still seems lame to me even though today's sideboard cards are a lot more fair.  
On the other hand, if you run stuff like this in your main deck along with stuff like [Sleight of Mind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sleight of Mind) or [Magical Hack](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Magical Hack), that is okay, if a bit cheap.
posts.html:
Yea, the old color hate cards completely lacked any subtlety or strategy. They were all basically "X color deck loses the game". White was the worst offender with cards like Justice, Karma, and the circles of protection. My friends and I never used them, and they are the reason that the concept of sideboarding still seems lame to me even though today's sideboard cards are a lot more fair.
On the other hand, if you run stuff like this in your main deck along with stuff like Sleight of Mind or Magical Hack, that is okay, if a bit cheap.
